creator: rvanoo@xs4all.nl
text:
cvstagdiff assumes that each line in the output from rdiff starts with 'File 
module/', where module is the name of the cvs module specified in the package 
attribute. This is not always the case:

- the specified module might be an ampersand module
- the specified module might have a differently named (root) directory

I think the solution should be 2-fold:

- the task should check that the line from the rdiff output indeed begins 
with 'File module/', and if it doesn't, only strip of the 'File ' part, 
unless ...
- an attribute (to be added to the task implementation), which specifies the 
part of the path to strip off is specified in the task

creator: rvanoo@xs4all.nl
text: did my investigation on last nights checkout of the main trunk

Would you mind attaching a patch for your proposal (with doc of course) ? ;-)

btw, does the bug mentioned in the following doc still exist ?
http://www.durak.org/cvswebsites/doc/cvs_158.php
creator: sbailliez@apache.org

text:
That bug still exists in CVS 1.11

I'm hoping to post a patch (including doc) this week. Work is a bit insane at 
the moment.
creator: rvanoo@xs4all.nl

text:
Just a thought:

I could have the task check the CVSROOT/modules file for the package that's 
being rdiff'ed. That way it would pick up on:

module someotherdir
module somebasedir/module
module &mod1 &mod2 &mod3

Any thoughts?
creator: rvanoo@xs4all.nl
